text: TEMPLE COLLEGE VOCATIONAL NURSING PROGRAM BASIC NURSING SKILLS VNSG 1423 MODULE II – MOBILITY AND SAFETY Chapters 18, 19, and 20 - Williams Upon completion of this module, the student will be able to: 1. Describe the use of proper body mechanics and the importance of preventing injury to patients and nursing staff. 2. Discuss the effects of immobility on various body systems and nursing measures to prevent complications of immobility. 3. Identify and discuss various client positions, position devices, and ambulatory/transfer devices. 4. Identify patients who are most at risk of falls and the nurse’s role in fall prevention. 5. Define ways to minimize safety hazards to nursing staff including fire, biohazards, chemical, and radiation hazards. 6. Discuss various forms of terrorism, safety measures to be taken, signs and symptoms of agents used, and measures to treat or contain the threat. 7. Discuss how to apply protective devices, the rationales, and nursing responsibilities associated with their use. Identify alternatives to using protective devices.
